Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What Is Exoticca?

Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like strong challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!

Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of voyages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, through the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. For more comfort, our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies.

At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of 300+ people, in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.

We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.

What is our proporsal?

The Data Analyst will be responsible for the development of a strong analytical foundation of the newly created Revenue Management team, in the Product department. He will be part of a quickly developing team, helping in the implementation of a new top-quality Revenue model in the industry.

What Wil You Do

Perform complex analysis related to precise business questions and deliver actionable insights.
Liaise with the company Data team, and collaborate with Data engineers and Data scientists in the company.
Be the point of reference for any matter related to data and analysis within the Revenue team.
Collecting and interpreting data from different sources in our Data Lake.
Provide business with meaningful dashboards or other tools.
Design, develop and maintain automated processes that help business improve manual workflow.


Requirements

Quantitative degree (IT, Mathematics, Physics,Statistics).
Strong knowledge of SQL.
At least 2 years of experience with programming languages such as R and especially Python for data analysis and modelling.
Experience building dashboards with Data visualisation tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI,..).
Passion for building things from scratch.
High level of English.


Benefits

Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience.
Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, and private health insurance with Cobee.
Hybrid or remote work model: you can work from home or the office at your convenience. Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Plaça Catalunya).
Permanent contract from the start.
Travel packages at reduced prices as perk for employees!
Unlimited coffee, language lessons, quarterly teamwork activities, global biannual parties.
And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!


Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te apasiona el Análisis de Datos? Buscamos una persona curiosa y creativa, con ganas de trabajar en equipo y de crecer y fomentar el crecimiento.




Incorporándote en el departamento de Inteligencias de Negocio, te integrarás en el equipo que impulsa el uso de los datos en la toma de decisiones de negocio transversal de toda la compañía y en general la obtención del máximo valor de negocio a partir del dato.

Tus principales funciones

Automatización de procesos utilizando las herramientas de BI y Analíticas (MicroStrategy, R).
Implantar metodologías de trabajo, impulsando el uso de herramientas analíticas corporativas y de tratamiento de los datos de la forma más eficiente posible.
Formar y mentorizar a personas de otros departamentos en el uso de estas herramientas.
Impulsar la Cultura Analítica, realizar acciones de divulgación sobre la extracción de valor a partir del dato y nuevas metodologías de análisis.
Trabajarás con otros departamentos para desarrollar soluciones basadas en datos, que respondan a sus necesidades de negocio.
Fomentar las sinergias interdepartamentales en el uso de los datos, impulsar el uso de terminología común (Business Glossary).
Participar en la consolidación de Grupo Caja de Ingenieros como una Entidad Data Driven, impulsando de forma transversal la toma de decisiones de negocio basadas en datos de forma óptima, así como la implantación de la cultura analítica o del dato, ajustada a los criterios éticos y de gobernanza.

Requisitos

Grado en ADE, Estadística, Matemáticas o Ingenierías.
Valorable Máster o Postgrado en Business Intelligence, Data Science o Data Analytics.
Mínimo 1 año de experiencia realizando análisis.
Valorable experiencia en sector financiero o asegurador.
Imprescindible conocimientos de herramientas de análisis R o Python: librerías TidyVerse, Pandas, Sklearn, etc. Visualización de datos: librerías ggplot, seaborn.
Valorable conocimientos de plataformas de BI y análisis: Microstrategy, Business Objects, etc. y de herramientas de CRM: Siebel, etc.
Valorable conocimientos de SQL y Visual Basic.
Catalán / Castellano
Inglés nivel First Certificate

Habilidades y experiencias

Capacidades Analíticas
Actitud Resolutiva
Capacidad de Aprendizaje
Adaptación al Cambio
Proactividad y Orientación a la Mejora
Trabajo en Equipo
Habilidades de Comunicación
Visualización de Datos




Ubicación: Barcelona

Contrato indefinido (contratación directa)

Jornada híbrida: 2 días teletrabajo, 3 presenciales.

Jornada intensiva viernes y agosto

Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales

Buen ambiente de trabajo dinámico y colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us.

Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 690 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for creating advanced data sets and turning them into insights for better decision making. You will collaborate with multiple stakeholders in order to identify new product and business opportunities and to deliver the best possible solutions for Wallapop from conception to production. On a day-to-day basis you will work with cross-functional teams of Product Managers, Developers and Designers, in order to identify new product opportunities and to deliver the best possible product solutions for Wallapop from conception to production.

You'll be part of a growing Data & Analytics chapter (30+ people and counting) reporting to the Analytics Manager in the TRX Tribe.

What You Will Do

Understand business, marketing and/or product needs and leverage insights so that the team can take data-informed decisions
Extract quantitative insights from data and interpret them in order to provide the team with actionable opportunities and to correctly assess knowledge gaps
Participate in the definition of the team main metrics and ensure its correct and reliable reporting through dashboards, notebooks, visualizations, etc.
Present and share quantitative insights and / or analysis across the company
Collaborate and participate in core analytics projects, such as maintaining and evolving the data platform, improving the documentation, completing strategic cross-business analysis
Promote data culture across the organization


What We're Looking For

Solid experience as data analyst, business analyst, product analyst or similar role preferably for a web/mobile company
Excellent statistical knowledge, especially concepts related to A/B testing
Proficiency in SQL
Experience working with reporting and data visualization tools like Looker, Tableau or Power BI
Product and business acumen
Great data visualization with well-structured storytelling
Assertiveness in decision-making and communication


What Would Be A Plus

Hands-on experience with experimentation
Experience working with dbt
Experience with tracking definition and events-based analysis
Good Python skills
Marketplace industry knowledge/experience


Do note that all our jobs are Barcelona based. We work in a mostly remote capacity offering great flexibility to our employees, but we believe in the power of getting together regularly in our office. As a first iteration, we expect a 4+ day/month office attendance for which the specifics are decided on a team level.

Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

We sponsor visa processes for international candidates when applicable and provide legal & admin support along the process combined with a competitive relocation package.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following Perks & Benefits:

Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year + our very own Wallalibrary
Group and individual English & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
Private Health Insurance with Cigna
Flexible working hours + short Fridays
Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
Extended newborn & adoption leave
Bonus for weddings & newborns
Wallarenta (Tax income support)
Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
Wallanniversary loyalty program
Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your wallahome office
Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
26 holidays per year
TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)


What does the hiring process for this position look like? **Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation, and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Task - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your technical skills and expertise required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture-Add Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Plastiks, we are committed to shaping the future of the web3 ecosystem through innovative products and technologies. Our flagship product, the Plastiks Marketplace, has revolutionized how users interact with digital assets and services. We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our team and support our mission to make a positive impact on the environment.




Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Plastiks, you will play a crucial role in turning raw data into actionable insights that drive our business forward. You will work closely with various departments, including sales, marketing, and product development, to collect, analyze, and interpret data that can help us make informed decisions and optimize our processes.

 

Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources, such as internal databases, external platforms, and third-party vendors.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in data to provide insights that can help guide business decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process improvements and drive data-driven solutions.
Create visualizations and dashboards to effectively communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations.
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in the plastics, manufacturing, or sustainability industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as SQL or Python.
Strong knowledge of statistical concepts and techniques, including regression analysis, hypothesis testing, and data modeling.
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau or Power BI.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex data to non-technical audiences.
A passion for sustainability and making a positive impact on the environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
AirDNA is a Denver-based technology startup revolutionizing the vacation rental industry, with a big office in Barcelona. In less than seven years, AirDNA has established itself as the leading provider of data and analytics for the $140 billion dollar industry. Our customer roster includes a who’s who of investment banks, hotels, hedge funds, real estate investors, and vacation rental pros. We are bootstrapped, profitable, and ambitious.

We have one of the most impactful datasets to come about in recent years. The short term rental industry has seen staggering growth, capturing the attention of hosts, real estate investors, hedge funds, the largest hotel players and beyond.

The AirDNA Team

At AirDNA, we’re ateamof data nerds on a mission to empower our customers tosmartlygrow their businesses. And we're looking for people with a broad range of experiences and perspectives, who are excited by our mission, values, and drive to change the short-term rental market. In short: Life is never boring here. And we genuinely live and breathe our company values: Happy, Hungry and Honest. People who are ready to exemplify these values are especially encouraged to apply.We invite you to apply even if you are unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. We carefully consider every application, not just those that check off all the boxes.

Your role

AirDNA is searching for a talented Technical Data Analyst to support our teams in Barcelona. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining pipelines/scripts for data exports and customer deliveries and internal processes, maintaining our Sales Tool and creating and analyzing custom datasets for our Public Relations, Customer Experience, and Sales teams.

We are looking for a hungry troubleshooter, with an analytical mindset and eagerness to get to the source of any problem. You need to be someone with an eye for trends and facility to identify anomalies in large datasets. You also care about customer happiness and know what questions to ask when given vague directions and understand what it means from a customer perspective a day of delay in getting a report. You enjoy being in contact and helping several teams across the organization.

Here's what you'll get to do:Maintain our internal programs and tools that generate our Enterprise Products.

Analyze and troubleshoot any problems that may arise with the data and pipelines. Be the Data Expert in the office.

Automate product deliveries and other processes.

Assist our PR team pulling and QAing datasets that will be used by world leading journalists. Analyze our Tableau Dashboards to find trends in the short-term rental market.

Work with our Sales and Customer Experience teams to set up new product deliveries and generate new reports. Assist our key clients with data ingestion and data deliveries.

Help expand our coverage by adding new requested markets on demand to our online tool.

Here's what you'll need to be successful:1+ years of experience working with SQL and Python (pandas, datetime, numpy, dictionaries, packages).

Full proficiency in English both verbally and written.

Experience with data visualization/BI tools such as Tableau.

Good level of Excel (pivot table, vlookups, formatting, etc).

Analyst mindset and an ability to identify automatable processes.

Excellent communication skills, data driven, critical thinker and attention to detail.

Understanding of what it means to work in a startup environment: self-starter, flexibility, ability to manage oneself effectively.

Data driven, critical thinker and hungry to learn.

Nice to have:Bachelor’s degree in Math, Engineering, CS, Statistics, Economics or another quantitative field.

Github/Gitlab exposure.

Having worked closely with Data Science, Data Engineering, Backend and/or Frontend teams or knowing what they are talking about.

Familiarity with any of the following: PostgreSQL, PostGIS, Jira, Jupyter Notebooks and related toolsets.

Experience in hospitality, tourism or short term reantal industry.

Here's what you can expect from us:Base Salary 30,000 euros

62 days per year to work from anywhere!

36 holidays per year

Health insurance with Sanitas (Vision + Dental included)

Continuing education stipend

Cobee card available for public transport, daycare, restaurants and health insurance

Individual growth plan to progress in the role

A fun and sunny office with big terraces

Talented international team and a vibrant work environment

Bottom-up management: we listen to your ideas and implement them

Team building events

Dog friendly office!

Hiring Process:First stage: Interview with the People Team at AirDNA (Online-30min)

Second stage: Technical exercise

Third stage: Meet a Peer, chat with our Data Analysts (Onsite 40min)

Final stage: Online meeting with the Hiring Manager (30min)

Ideal start date: May

The AirDNA Team

We're a tight-knit group who care about empowering the next generation of shared economy entrepreneurs. Life is never boring here. We're risk takers. We care about each other and lend helping hands all day, every day.

At AirDNA, we believe that a diverse team is a key part of building a great company. If you want to work with us, we want to hear from you. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

AirDNA seeks to attract the best-qualified candidates who support the mission, vision and values of the company and those who respect and promote excellence through diversity. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, physical or mental disability, marital, familial or parental status, genetic information, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected classification. Thecompany complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment and prohibits unlawful harassment based on any of the aforementioned protected classes at every location in which the company operates. This applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment including but not limited to: hiring, assessments, probation, placement, benefits, promotion, demotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, training and development, social and recreational programs, education assistance and retirement.

We are committed to making our application process and workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. Upon request, AirDNA will reasonably accommodate applicants so they can participate in the application process unless doing so would create an undue hardship to AirDNA or a threat to these individuals, others in the workplace or the company as a whole. To request accommodation, please email ****** . Please allow for 24 hours to process your request.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Applicants .
Show more Show less
HTML:
AirDNA is a Denver-based technology startup revolutionizing the vacation rental industry, with a big office in Barcelona. In less than seven years, AirDNA has established itself as the leading provider of data and analytics for the $140 billion dollar industry. Our customer roster includes a who’s who of investment banks, hotels, hedge funds, real estate investors, and vacation rental pros. We are bootstrapped, profitable, and ambitious.

We have one of the most impactful datasets to come about in recent years. The short term rental industry has seen staggering growth, capturing the attention of hosts, real estate investors, hedge funds, the largest hotel players and beyond.

The AirDNA Team

At AirDNA, we’re ateamof data nerds on a mission to empower our customers tosmartlygrow their businesses. And we're looking for people with a broad range of experiences and perspectives, who are excited by our mission, values, and drive to change the short-term rental market. In short: Life is never boring here. And we genuinely live and breathe our company values: Happy, Hungry and Honest. People who are ready to exemplify these values are especially encouraged to apply.We invite you to apply even if you are unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. We carefully consider every application, not just those that check off all the boxes.

Your role

AirDNA is searching for a talented Technical Data Analyst to support our teams in Barcelona. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining pipelines/scripts for data exports and customer deliveries and internal processes, maintaining our Sales Tool and creating and analyzing custom datasets for our Public Relations, Customer Experience, and Sales teams.

We are looking for a hungry troubleshooter, with an analytical mindset and eagerness to get to the source of any problem. You need to be someone with an eye for trends and facility to identify anomalies in large datasets. You also care about customer happiness and know what questions to ask when given vague directions and understand what it means from a customer perspective a day of delay in getting a report. You enjoy being in contact and helping several teams across the organization.

Here's what you'll get to do:Maintain our internal programs and tools that generate our Enterprise Products.

Analyze and troubleshoot any problems that may arise with the data and pipelines. Be the Data Expert in the office.

Automate product deliveries and other processes.

Assist our PR team pulling and QAing datasets that will be used by world leading journalists. Analyze our Tableau Dashboards to find trends in the short-term rental market.

Work with our Sales and Customer Experience teams to set up new product deliveries and generate new reports. Assist our key clients with data ingestion and data deliveries.

Help expand our coverage by adding new requested markets on demand to our online tool.

Here's what you'll need to be successful:1+ years of experience working with SQL and Python (pandas, datetime, numpy, dictionaries, packages).

Full proficiency in English both verbally and written.

Experience with data visualization/BI tools such as Tableau.

Good level of Excel (pivot table, vlookups, formatting, etc).

Analyst mindset and an ability to identify automatable processes.

Excellent communication skills, data driven, critical thinker and attention to detail.

Understanding of what it means to work in a startup environment: self-starter, flexibility, ability to manage oneself effectively.

Data driven, critical thinker and hungry to learn.

Nice to have:Bachelor’s degree in Math, Engineering, CS, Statistics, Economics or another quantitative field.

Github/Gitlab exposure.

Having worked closely with Data Science, Data Engineering, Backend and/or Frontend teams or knowing what they are talking about.

Familiarity with any of the following: PostgreSQL, PostGIS, Jira, Jupyter Notebooks and related toolsets.

Experience in hospitality, tourism or short term reantal industry.

Here's what you can expect from us:Base Salary 30,000 euros

62 days per year to work from anywhere!

36 holidays per year

Health insurance with Sanitas (Vision + Dental included)

Continuing education stipend

Cobee card available for public transport, daycare, restaurants and health insurance

Individual growth plan to progress in the role

A fun and sunny office with big terraces

Talented international team and a vibrant work environment

Bottom-up management: we listen to your ideas and implement them

Team building events

Dog friendly office!

Hiring Process:First stage: Interview with the People Team at AirDNA (Online-30min)

Second stage: Technical exercise

Third stage: Meet a Peer, chat with our Data Analysts (Onsite 40min)

Final stage: Online meeting with the Hiring Manager (30min)

Ideal start date: May

The AirDNA Team

We're a tight-knit group who care about empowering the next generation of shared economy entrepreneurs. Life is never boring here. We're risk takers. We care about each other and lend helping hands all day, every day.

At AirDNA, we believe that a diverse team is a key part of building a great company. If you want to work with us, we want to hear from you. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

AirDNA seeks to attract the best-qualified candidates who support the mission, vision and values of the company and those who respect and promote excellence through diversity. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, physical or mental disability, marital, familial or parental status, genetic information, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected classification. Thecompany complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment and prohibits unlawful harassment based on any of the aforementioned protected classes at every location in which the company operates. This applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment including but not limited to: hiring, assessments, probation, placement, benefits, promotion, demotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, training and development, social and recreational programs, education assistance and retirement.

We are committed to making our application process and workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. Upon request, AirDNA will reasonably accommodate applicants so they can participate in the application process unless doing so would create an undue hardship to AirDNA or a threat to these individuals, others in the workplace or the company as a whole. To request accommodation, please email ****** . Please allow for 24 hours to process your request.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Applicants .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Summary

Product Madness is a Global Powerhouse where the greatest mobile games and experiences are crafted by world-class talent. A top-grossing leader in free to play mobile games, we have more than 800 team members working across seven global talent hubs including London (headquarters), USA, Canada, Spain, Poland and Ukraine. With remarkable hit games including Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and Big Fish Casino, we boast more than 50 million active users and 400 million downloads and counting.

We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what brings us together as a studio, connects us with our partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.

Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital game’s division of Pixel United.

Job Posting Title

Data Analyst

Summary

We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data/Product Analyst. You will be working together with other product analysts and data scientists embedded in our games team. You will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning product data from big datasets. Thus, covering the full scope of data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to show the impact of product data via dashboards and/or other means of visualisations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the craft of analytics in Product Madness and to ensure the game teams are making informed decisions based on actionable insights. Your key responsibilities will be:


Working closely with product and the game teams, implement tracking in games to capture player data and create reports that give further insight into player behaviour and product performance.
Form new insights and perspectives that inform decisions and help us continue to delight the people playing our games.
Produce reports and deliver insights that have an impact on the future direction of our games and the game roadmap.
Work with game teams and DWH to produce end to end data pipelines that empower end users.
Work closely with product and game teams to create reports and monitoring of daily KPIs.
Investigating issues in the Production environment, analysing and optimising existing product features and A/B tests.
Apply creative thinking towards designing, testing, verifying, and implementing solutions.



Why should you join us?

As well we having the ability to grow and develop your career and work for a people first business that looks after all employees, you will also get some amazing benefits + an outstanding salary


25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off
Flexibility of 1 hours at the start and end of the working day + Summer working hours
Yearly bonus scheme
Fully hybrid working arrangements to suit you
50€ Amazon voucher for your birthday
40€ via Uber Eats voucher every month - have a take a way on us
WFH allowance of 250€ (one off) to set up your home office
Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees.
GYMPASS - free gym membership
Basket of Fruit worth 25€ each month of fruit and veggies sent to your house.
F&B provided at designated PM Games/Social Nights
Referral Scheme of 5000€ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period)



What We're Looking For

What we look for in you


Previous experience in a product or data analyst role
Strong SQL and Excel skills
Experience of standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/Power BI etc.
Working experience setting up and analyzing A/B-tests would be desirable
Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and data
Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry, any experience in these industries would be highly desirable
Fluent in English
A Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a analytical field is preferred
Experience with Python and/or R would be ideal but not essential



Why Product Madness?

Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.

We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.

Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.

With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.

We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.

We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.

Our Values


People First



We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More



Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive



We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused



We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

R0012841

Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.

With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.

We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.

We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
OBS Business School es la 1ª Business School 100% born online en España. Con más de 36.000 alumnos formados desde nuestra fundación, ofrecemos MBAs y Másters online que se adaptan a las necesidades del mercado nacional como internacional en constante evolución. OBS Business School forma parte de Planeta Formación y Universidades (división educación de Grupo Planeta), unos de los grupos líderes en el sector educativo en el mundo hispanohablante.

Para apoyar a nuestro crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional, estamos en la búsqueda de Data Analyst, apasionado de los datos para el Departamento de Admisiones.

Misión del Puesto:

Dominar nuestra herramienta de gestión de candidatos para la extracción de información.
Gestionar la información comercial disponible en el Departamento de Admisiones a fin de generar el reportings necesarios para el correcto seguimiento de indicadores.
Analizar los procesos existentes en los cuales se recopilan datos para proponer una optimización sustentada en la planificación a desarrollar con los estándares que permita el contexto de negocio y las herramientas disponibles.
Dar visibilidad de toda la información del departamento con diferentes Dashboard.
Dar soporte en el proceso de toma de decisiones estratégicas del área proporcionando datos fiables a partir de la información recopilada.


Funciones:

Dominio del proceso en nuestro CRM
Creación, optimización y propuesta de circuitos
Identificación y creación de KPI’s
Optimización y gestión de BBDD
Realizar Dashboard (cuadros de mando) fiables
Reportes: diarios, semanales y mensuales


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato Indefinido y a jornada completa (Horario de 12h a 21h)
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.


Requisitos:

Conocimientos:

Dominio muy avanzado de Excel
Dominio muy avanzado de Power BI, herramienta clave para los reportings
BBDD: Extracción-Transformación-Visualización-Carga (ETL)
Se valorarán favorablemente conocimientos en: SQL, QLIK, Programación PYTHON, Programación R


Habilidades:

Persona proactiva, resolutiva y exigente
Aporte ideas y soluciones
Anticipación problemas
Facilitador de toma de decisiones
Analítico, atención al detalle, estructurado
Fiable, confiable y metódico
Visión de negocio

Title: DATA ANALYST JUNIOR
Description:
Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados




Se precisa incorporar a una persona de perfil analítico con ganas de aprender y desarrollarse en consultoría especializada en marketing y transformación digital.




Tareas:




Buscamos un Digital Analyst para nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, con un mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en el uso de herramientas de analítica y reporting que formará parte del equipo de Analytics y Customer Insights.




Trabajará en proyectos donde desarrollará las siguientes funciones:




Analizar grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos para generar insights sobre comportamientos de clientes.
Desarrollar marcos, modelos, herramientas y procesos para garantizar que los datos influyan en las decisiones en todos los niveles.
Análisis avanzado de los resultados de performance Marketing y atribución.
Presentación de resultados a cliente y propuesta de implementaciones para la mejora de resultados.
Configuración de reporting avanzado en herramientas de visualización unificando diferentes fuentes de datos.
Procesar datos utilizando Excel de forma rápida y generando confianza
Diseño y e implementación de Cuadros de Mando.




Requisitos:




Formación: ADE / Marketing / Marketing Digital / Tecnologías de la información / Informática o Ingeniería similar.
Experiencia: Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en proyectos similares a las funciones descritas.
Habilidades básicas en el uso de herramientas y lenguajes de análisis utilizados para manipular y exportar datos en grandes conjuntos de datos (SQL) y para analizar / automatizar (Python/ R).
Nociones básicas en herramientas BI (Qlikview, Tableau o PowerBI).
Pensamiento crítico y capacidades de resolución de problemas.
Apasionado por el mundo de los datos y de la analítica de clientes
Personas con capacidades comunicativas y de interlocución con clientes. No buscamos sólo perfiles de “back-office”.
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.
Alto nivel de inglés




Ofrecemos:




Puesto de trabajo en nuestras oficinas situadas en el centro de Barcelona.
Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (online/ presencial)
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (campeonatos de eGames, concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.




Descripción de la Firma




Firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial. Nuestra misión es mantener el estándar de alta calidad alcanzado gracias a la labor diaria de los más de 10.000 profesionales que trabajan con nosotros en nuestras oficinas repartidas por toda España.




Esta diversidad geográfica permite ofrecer un servicio ágil y eficaz a sus clientes. La compañía ha sido valorada por universitarios, empleados y la población en general, como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España, gracias a sus políticas de carrera profesional, formación y entorno de trabajo.




Siempre enfocados a las necesidades específicas de cada tipo de negocio, desarrollamos soluciones personalizadas en las áreas de Auditoría, Consultoría, Gestión del Riesgo, Asesoramiento Legal y Fiscal y Asesoramiento en Transacciones.




Nuestro verdadero éxito depende de la capacidad de su equipo humano, ¿te animas a unirte a nosotros?




Descripción de la Línea de negocio de Digital




La unidad de Digital es un equipo creativo e innovador dentro de la firma.




Nuestro trabajo se basa en el conocimiento profundo de los clientes, el mercado potencial y el entorno competitivo para generar una experiencia de cliente diferencial. Nuestras soluciones se centran en las áreas de modelos de negocio de digital, gestión de campañas, analítica web, redes sociales, gestión de contenidos y optimización en medios digitales.




¿Qué nos hace diferentes?




Nuestra diferencia proviene de nuestra diversidad. Tenemos la visión de negocio de un asesor, la capacidad de diseño de una agencia creativa y el conocimiento de la ingeniería de una empresa de tecnología. Ofrecemos propuestas integradas a nuestros clientes en el futuro de la tecnología digital, soluciones que llevan en esencia un intenso compromiso con la calidad.




¿Quieres trabajar con nosotros?




Ofrecemos proyectos de alto nivel, atractivos, dinámicos y con visión de futuro.




Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡No lo dudes, únete a nosotros!
Show more Show less
HTML:
Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados


Se precisa incorporar a una persona de perfil analítico con ganas de aprender y desarrollarse en consultoría especializada en marketing y transformación digital.


Tareas:


Buscamos un Digital Analyst para nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, con un mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en el uso de herramientas de analítica y reporting que formará parte del equipo de Analytics y Customer Insights.


Trabajará en proyectos donde desarrollará las siguientes funciones:


  • Analizar grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos para generar insights sobre comportamientos de clientes.
  • Desarrollar marcos, modelos, herramientas y procesos para garantizar que los datos influyan en las decisiones en todos los niveles.
  • Análisis avanzado de los resultados de performance Marketing y atribución.
  • Presentación de resultados a cliente y propuesta de implementaciones para la mejora de resultados.
  • Configuración de reporting avanzado en herramientas de visualización unificando diferentes fuentes de datos.
  • Procesar datos utilizando Excel de forma rápida y generando confianza
  • Diseño y e implementación de Cuadros de Mando.


Requisitos:


  • Formación: ADE / Marketing / Marketing Digital / Tecnologías de la información / Informática o Ingeniería similar.
  • Experiencia: Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en proyectos similares a las funciones descritas.
  • Habilidades básicas en el uso de herramientas y lenguajes de análisis utilizados para manipular y exportar datos en grandes conjuntos de datos (SQL) y para analizar / automatizar (Python/ R).
  • Nociones básicas en herramientas BI (Qlikview, Tableau o PowerBI).
  • Pensamiento crítico y capacidades de resolución de problemas.
  • Apasionado por el mundo de los datos y de la analítica de clientes
  • Personas con capacidades comunicativas y de interlocución con clientes. No buscamos sólo perfiles de “back-office”.
  • Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.
  • Alto nivel de inglés


Ofrecemos:


  • Puesto de trabajo en nuestras oficinas situadas en el centro de Barcelona.
  • Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
  • Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
  • Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
  • Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
  • Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
  • Modelo de trabajo híbrido (online/ presencial)
  • Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
  • Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
  • Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
  • Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (campeonatos de eGames, concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.


Descripción de la Firma


Firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial. Nuestra misión es mantener el estándar de alta calidad alcanzado gracias a la labor diaria de los más de 10.000 profesionales que trabajan con nosotros en nuestras oficinas repartidas por toda España.


Esta diversidad geográfica permite ofrecer un servicio ágil y eficaz a sus clientes. La compañía ha sido valorada por universitarios, empleados y la población en general, como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España, gracias a sus políticas de carrera profesional, formación y entorno de trabajo.


Siempre enfocados a las necesidades específicas de cada tipo de negocio, desarrollamos soluciones personalizadas en las áreas de Auditoría, Consultoría, Gestión del Riesgo, Asesoramiento Legal y Fiscal y Asesoramiento en Transacciones.


Nuestro verdadero éxito depende de la capacidad de su equipo humano, ¿te animas a unirte a nosotros?


Descripción de la Línea de negocio de Digital


La unidad de Digital es un equipo creativo e innovador dentro de la firma.


Nuestro trabajo se basa en el conocimiento profundo de los clientes, el mercado potencial y el entorno competitivo para generar una experiencia de cliente diferencial. Nuestras soluciones se centran en las áreas de modelos de negocio de digital, gestión de campañas, analítica web, redes sociales, gestión de contenidos y optimización en medios digitales.


¿Qué nos hace diferentes?


Nuestra diferencia proviene de nuestra diversidad. Tenemos la visión de negocio de un asesor, la capacidad de diseño de una agencia creativa y el conocimiento de la ingeniería de una empresa de tecnología. Ofrecemos propuestas integradas a nuestros clientes en el futuro de la tecnología digital, soluciones que llevan en esencia un intenso compromiso con la calidad.


¿Quieres trabajar con nosotros?


Ofrecemos proyectos de alto nivel, atractivos, dinámicos y con visión de futuro.


Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡No lo dudes, únete a nosotros!

Title: 🏠 Data Analyst - Tableau (Barcelona) 🏠
Description:
Si eres un apasionado de los Datos y estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales, tenemos los proyectos que estás buscando.




Nuestra Comunidad Tecnológica experta en Big Data/BI no para de crecer y necesitamos incorporar un equipo un/a Business Insights que estén listos para un nuevo desafío. Es necesaria experiencia trabajando herramientas de visualización, como Tableau, aunque también es valorable otras, como Power BI.




Se trata de un puesto híbrida, 1 día a la semana se asiste a sus oficinas de Barcelona, los otros 4 días se teletrabaja.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?




Experiencia aproximada de 2 a 5 años en Tableau / Business Insights.

- Experiencia con herramientas de visualización, preferiblemente TABLEAU, POWER BI o en herramientas similares.

- Experiencia entorno a los tres / cuatro años.

- Se unirá al equipo de BUSINESS INSIGHTS, preferible con experiencia en el área comercial. Por ello será necesario que aporte experiencia y don de gentes.







Y además, que más te ofrecemos?




· 22 días de vacaciones, 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de Diciembre (cierre de empresa)




·Te podrás beneficiar de un completo programa de beneficios y descuentos (ocio, tecnología, bienestar y salud). ¿Quieres ejemplos? Tienes infinitas posibilidades desde contratar Gympass o Fisio-Empresas, pasando por ofertas en móviles y portátiles, hasta descuentos para irte de viaje, reservar un vuelo o pillar un alquiler de coche ¡Tú elijes!




·Acceso y formación en todo tipo de conocimiento técnico, habilidades o idiomas.




·Participación en eventos tecnológicos. Nosotros somos patrocinadores de eventos como el Codemotion, t3chfest y sobre todo estamos orgullosos de ser los organizadores de eventos técnicos como el blockchain spain y DevOps Spain.




·Nos acordamos de ti en los momentos importantes de tu vida (aniversario de trabajo, cumpleaños y nacimiento). ¡Tienes sorpresa asegurada!




·Vamos más allá del trabajo, por eso nos gusta organizar los Family days, para que te diviertas con tu familia en atSistemas.




·Tienes acceso a nuestros meetups, techdays y a nuestro blog tecnológico ¿Todavía no conoces https://enmilocalfunciona.io/?




·Actividades de Teambuilding: Nos gusta divertirnos y estar en contacto con nuestros




Trabajamos en entornos agile, flexible, con máxima conciliación y teletrabajo y equipos horizontales de trabajo con una cultura de colaboración, compromiso e innovación.




En atSistemas nos rodeamos de un buen ambiente y buena gente, donde se rema en la misma dirección para que todas las personas desarrollen su carrera profesional. Somos un ecosistema de talento y de oportunidades, podrás dirigir tu desarrollo profesional y tener conversaciones con tus responsables para localizar experiencias profesionales que consoliden tus nuevos conocimientos.




Si te identificas con estos valores, no lo dudes y únete a nuestro equipo!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Business Data Analyst

Are you excited about working in a revolutionising tech company? Do you have ambition to create impact at a high speed, in a collaborative environment? If so, then we want to hear from you!

As a Senior Business Data Analyst you will play a key role in the Strategy and Analytics central function, which looks after advanced analytics, performance reporting and data quality control across our 13 geographical divisions.

You will need to hit the ground running, and be super proactive with a ‘yes-I-can [and if not right now, I will find out how :) ]’ attitude!

We work following Kanban principles, with a backlog review in which you will pitch projects and lead/execute them in a multifunctional team. We are ambitious, and we want to grow…. so the more you grow the more we do too.

You Will Be Responsible For

Drive deep dive analytics and performance reporting
Translating business requirements into data needs, with proper articulation
Collaborate with the team to propose projects to drive business performance and growth
Communicating with stakeholders across the business


About You

STEM BSc background or MSc with numerical background.
SaaS/MarketPlace experience is definitely a big plus.
Proven experience in a data analyst/BI role, showing very strong analytical skills combined with a great business acumen
A strategic mindset and a hands-on mentality, with a team player attitude
Flexible and willing to go the extra mile if necessary
Very strong communication and presentation skills, someone capable to ‘translate’ business needs into data requirements, and present insights/stories in a compelling way to senior management.
Tech Skills: SQL, Excel, Looker. Bonus points for: Python [Numpy/Pandas] & dbt
You feel comfortable communicating in English. Any other language is a plus
You have 4-6 years of experience
Available to work in a hybrid way (3 days at the office at Carrer de Balmes 7, 08007, Barcelona and 2 days from home)


About Treatwell

Hi, we’re Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

We’re a team of 800 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We’re the industry’s smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe’s leading bookings platform, working with over 50,000 salon partners across 13 countries, processing over 8 million bookings every month. And….breathe.

But we’re not done yet. We’re on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community.

If this excites you, we might just have the role for you.

We’ll Treat You With

28-days holiday, plus bank holidays
Monthly 40 EUR Treatwell vouchers so you can treat yourself too
Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team
A discount for gym membership
Free breakfast and fruits in the office
A dynamic organisation with regular social events and lots of other cool parties!
Annual Treatwell retreat to a sunny European destination
A challenging and hybrid job at one of the fastest growing companies in Europe
All the tools / devices supplied to do the best job you can eg. laptop, monitor, keyboard, etc


Equal Ops

Treatwell is an ‘Open to All’ employer and warmly welcomes every body to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

As a People Data Analyst, you will be working alongside a passionate and dynamic team of people analytics professionals to drive data-informed decisions related to our people operations, with a particular focus on Talent Management.

This role will be embedded within our People team, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of team members who share your passion for using data to drive business outcomes.

The main responsibilities will be:

Partner with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and develop dashboards that provide insights into our people operations.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends and patterns that inform business decisions.
Participate and co-drive the creation of an People data platform and develop models and frameworks to support strategic
workforce planning, talent acquisition, retention, and performance management.
Collaborate with HR, Finance, and other business functions to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Advocate for a data-driven approach, building processes to ensure data quality excellence and ability to advise on internal mobility decisions.
Support Chief People Officer in the preparation of documentation material for various audiences including the Company’s Board of Directors.
Proactively seek out new opportunities for data analysis and continuous improvement within our people analytics function, helping to shape the future of our organization.


Qualities we value for the role:

>2 years of experience in a People Data Analyst role or similar roles.
Knowledge of People functions and metrics.
Proven ability to be analytical and handle data effectively.
Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients.
Advanced knowledge of Google Sheets, alternatively, Excel.
Working knowledge in data visualization tools (Looker Studio, or other data visualization tools).
Understanding of and experience with SQL and relational databases.
Experience with ETL tools and Python knowledge is highly valued.
Ability to communicate fluently in English, as it is our main working language.


What do we offer?

A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.
Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills trainings, language lessons as well as a subscription to Coursera Online Learning.
Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.
We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!
A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.
New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.
Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.
Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!


… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world's largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world's largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe's fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world's most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do

Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
Good knowledge of Python is a plus
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


Why should you join Proton?

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world's top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We're one of Europe's fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else's problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.


Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.
Show more Show less
HTML:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world's largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world's largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe's fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world's most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do
  • Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
  • Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
  • Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
  • Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
  • Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
  • Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
  • Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units

Job Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
  • at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
  • Good knowledge of Python is a plus
  • Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas

Why should you join Proton?
  • Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
  • Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world's top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
  • Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
  • Grow with us - We're one of Europe's fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
  • Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else's problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
  • Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

Title: Data Analyst - UI/UX
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
¿Te interesa trabajar en I+D dentro de un entorno internacional? ¿Te interesa el análisis de datos? ¿Tienes experiencia en UI/UX?

En BETWEEN apostamos por ofrecerte las mejores oportunidades dentro del área tecnológica. Contamos con un equipo de más de 800 profesionales. Ser parte de nuestro equipo significa formar parte de una comunidad multicultural, con acceso a oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional, generando impacto.

Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en un entorno internacional, apostando por trabajar en soluciones de I+D tanto en Ingeniería como en IT, ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Operaciones, Desarrollo de producto, Compras, Firmware, Software, Business Intelligence, Gestión, Transformación digital, ¡y muchas más! Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros Hubs Tecnológicos.

La persona seleccionada extaerá métricas de la experiencia de usuario para la toma de decisiones

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:

Te encargarás del análisis de datos mediante herramientas de BI
Gestionarás las métricas de la UX/UI del producto
Te coordinarás con el equipo de desarrollo de Software para sacar las métricas
Reportarás los datos a los diferentes negocios


¿Cómo lo haré?

Tendrás horario flexible
Te integrarás en un equipo de alto rendimiento y con un alto grado de especialización.
Podrás trabajar en modelo híbrido
Tendrás un PC y los periféricos necesarios para el desarrollo de tu trabajo.
Podrás trabajar desde casa de cliente, nuestras oficinas de Barcelona en el 22@, los Hubs Tecnológicos o en el resto de las oficinas.
Trabajarás en un entorno internacional.


Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios:

Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras fantásticas oficinas del 22@ las cuales disponen de Rooftop, tirador de cerveza, mesa de ping-pong y futbolín.
Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.


Requisitos:

Experiencia en UI/IX y en herramientas de visualización (PowerBI, Qlick, Tableau)
Inglés avanzado
Capacidades para la gestión de proyectos
Experiencia en equipos de SW/Producto
Valorable formación técnica en Informática, telecomunicaciones o similar

Title: Analista de datos
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Si eres un apasionado de los datos 💹 y estás en búsqueda del proyecto dónde puedas aplicar tus conocimientos de análisis al negocio 📋, esta es tu oportunidad 🚀🚀🚀:

 

✨Tu día a día consistirá en:

Analizar datos e información de negocio (precios, ventas, margen, penetración de producto por zona, fabricante, etc.).

Desarrollar visualizaciones claras para transmitir datos complejos de manera directa.

Preparación de reportes e informes para managers y fabricantes.

Proporcionar información detallada para la toma de decisiones.

 

💡Serás nuestro-a candidato-a ideal si:

Te apasiona las bases de datos y el análisis.

Tienes formación en ADE y/o equivalente, o específica en análisis de datos.    

Dominas el Excel (las tablas dinámicas y macros han formado parte de tu día a día).

Has trabajado 2-3 años realizando tareas similares a las descritas.

 

🥇¿Por qué sumarte al EquipoGES?

Autonomía: aquí serás libre de proponer nuevas ideas de mejora relacionadas con tu día a día.

Al ritmo de la distribución: trabajar en un entorno en constante transformación hace que cada día sea un reto.

Rodearte de grandes profesionales: trabajarás codo con codo con un equipo de profesionales con gran orientación a resultados.

Tendrás acceso a nuestro Plan de Retribución Flexible (Tarjeta Restaurante, Guardería, Seguro Médico Privado, Tarjeta Transporte, Formación).

Seguro de Vida a cargo de la empresa.

Posibilidad de tele trabajar 6 días al mes. 




😉Para que nos conozcas un poco mejor:

Visita nuestra web: https://www.grupoelectrostocks.com/trabaja-con-nosotros

https://www.linkedin.com/company/grupoelectrostocks/




Únete a nuestro equipo, ¡estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI (inglés alto)
Description:
Si tu objetivo es seguir creciendo profesionalmente en el área de los datos, ésta es tu oferta!




¿Qué puede ofrecerte atSistemas?




👩‍💻Plan de Carrera: Todos nuestros profesionales tienen a su disposición procesos diseñados específicamente para sus funciones dentro de la compañía: modelo de competencias, evaluaciones, planes de formación y certificación, proyectos y eventos.

✈Vacaciones: 22 días laborables + 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de diciembre (cierre empresa)

✨Formación: Tendrás opciones para formarte en las últimas tecnologías y en INGLES! Además podrás contar con nuestro programa de certificaciones oficiales y las licencias de Udemy Business. Consulta nuestro calendario formativo: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/formacion

🎁Sorpresas: Recibirás sorpresas en momentos especiales

🎈Plan Amigo: Puedes ser Embajador de nuestra marca a través de nuestro Plan Amigo

🌱Quokka: programa de actividades para promover el bienestar emocional, la actividad física, y la nutrición saludable

🏆Club de ventajas: Programa de beneficios y descuentos (ocio, tecnología, bienestar y salud...)

🤍Kudos: Iniciativa para fomentar una cultura de feedback y reconocimiento




¿Qué es relevante? Cuanto más mejor, pero tenemos ofertas tanto nivel medio como senior




- Elaboración de informes y cuadros de mando con Power BI. Conocimiento medio/alto

- Creación de modelos, ETL (extracción, transformación y carga) y transformación de consultas

- Documentación y gestión de evolutivos

Experiencia con Cloud (Redshift)




Trabajarás en un cliente del sector farmacéutico (biotecnología y farmacia inteligente).




Es necesario aportar nivel alto de inglés y tener disponibilidad para desplazarte 1 o 2 días a la semana a sus oficinas, ubicadas en Barcelona ciudad.







Si te identificas con estos valores, no lo dudes y únete a nuestro equipo!
